name: Traditional/Old School
description: Features bold black outlines, bright primary colors, and iconic designs such as roses, anchors, eagles, and skulls.

name: Neo-Traditional
description: A modern take on traditional tattoos with more intricate shading, broader color palettes, and detailed designs.

name: Realism
description: Hyper-realistic tattoos that mimic photographs or real-life subjects.

name: Blackwork
description: Uses black ink to create intricate patterns, geometric shapes, and detailed shading.

name: Watercolor
description: Known for its soft, flowing color gradients that resemble watercolor paintings.

name: Geometric
description: Features shapes like circles, triangles, and lines in precise and symmetrical patterns.

name: Minimalist
description: Simple and clean designs, often with thin lines and limited color use.

name: Tribal
description: Consists of bold, black lines and patterns that often have cultural or spiritual significance.

name: Japanese
description: Traditional Japanese tattoos feature large, colorful designs, often including mythological creatures, floral elements, and symbols like koi fish and dragons.

name: Dotwork
description: Utilizes dots to create shading, patterns, and images.

name: Surrealism
description: Inspired by surrealist art, these tattoos depict dreamlike or fantastical scenes.

name: Trash Polka
description: A bold and unique style combining realistic imagery with splashes of red and black paint.

name: Fine Line
description: Features delicate, thin lines to create detailed and intricate designs.

name: Lettering/Script
description: Tattoos focused on typography, whether quotes, names, or phrases.

name: Portrait
description: Realistic or stylized portraits of people, often done in black and gray or full color.
